summary: A declaration by an anonymous Epstein victim (Jane Doe 1) objecting to the class action settlement against JPMorgan Chase Bank. The declarant alleges that JPMorgan executive Adam Castellani was assigned as her 'minder' to prevent her from reporting Epstein's crimes, and raises conflicts of interest involving class counsel David Boies and others connected to Bill Clinton and Harvey Weinstein.

persons.name: Jane Doe 1
persons.context: Anonymous victim and survivor of Jeffrey Epstein's crimes who is objecting to the class action settlement against JPMorgan Chase Bank. She details being groomed and monitored by JPMorgan executive Adam Castellani.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the sex trafficking ring. Described as JPMorgan's 'most significant client' during the relevant period and the perpetrator who raped the declarant hundreds of times.

persons.name: Adam Castellani
persons.role: Vice President of Media Relations at JPMorgan Chase Bank
persons.context: JPMorgan executive who the declarant alleges was sent as her personal 'minder' in January 2007. She claims he lived with her, discouraged her from reporting to police, and was aware of Epstein's status as a major client.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Attorney for the class whom the declarant objects to due to his 'cosy relationship' with Bill Clinton and past representation of Harvey Weinstein, alleging a conflict of interest.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Described as a 'well-known associate of Jeffrey Epstein' and a close friend of David Boies. Mentioned in the context of alleged trafficking aid.

persons.name: John Stanley Pottinger
persons.context: Law partner of Brad Edwards and associate of David Boies. Mentioned in a New York Times article about meeting a mysterious man after Epstein's death. His disappearance from firm websites is noted.

persons.name: Bradley J. Edwards
persons.context: Florida lawyer representing women with claims against Epstein. Law partner of John Stanley Pottinger. The declarant questions his motives and connections.

persons.name: Simone Lelank
persons.context: Administrator chosen for the settlement whom the declarant alleges has conflicts of interest due to previous work on Harvey Weinstein victim compensation and prior employment with Weinstein.

persons.name: Harvey Weinstein
persons.context: Former client of David Boies. Mentioned as a close friend of Boies and in relation to Simone Lelank's prior work on his victims' fund.

persons.name: James Marsh
persons.context: Attorney from Marsh Law Firm PLLC representing the declarant (Jane Doe 1) in this objection.

persons.name: Kessler
persons.context: A man who called himself Kessler and contacted Bradley Edwards regarding Epstein victim claims, as reported by the New York Times. His identity and motives are questioned.

connections.description: Castellani was allegedly sent by JPMorgan as a 'minder' to the victim, moved into her home, and gaslit her to prevent her from reporting Epstein's crimes.
Castellani, as JPMorgan's VP of Media Relations, was allegedly aware that Epstein was the bank's 'most significant client' and acted to protect the bank's interests related to Epstein.
The declarant alleges Boies has maintained a 'cosy relationship' with Clinton, a well-known associate of Jeffrey Epstein.
Boies previously worked on behalf of Harvey Weinstein, which the declarant cites as a source of criticism and potential conflict.
Pottinger is or was the law partner of Brad Edwards, though he was recently 'quietly and mysteriously dropped' from the firm's website.
Pottinger met with Boies after Epstein's death, as reported by the New York Times. The declarant suggests a collaborative relationship.
Lelank previously served as a claims examiner for Weinstein's sex abuse victims and had prior employment with Weinstein, according to the declarant.
The declarant states she was raped hundreds of times by Epstein and trafficked by him and his company.

events.title: Adam Castellani Assigned as 'Minder'
events.description: Adam Castellani, a JPMorgan VP, was allegedly sent to be the personal 'minder' for Jane Doe 1, beginning an 18-month coercive relationship where he discouraged her from reporting Epstein.

events.title: Epstein's Plea Bargain
events.description: The non-prosecution agreement (plea bargain) for Jeffrey Epstein is referenced. The declarant implies her silence, influenced by Castellani, may have prevented it from being exposed earlier.

events.title: Declarant Comes Forward
events.description: Jane Doe 1 states she came forward publicly about her abuse, beginning media appearances to seek justice.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Epstein's death in August 2019 is mentioned as the event after which a mysterious man (Kessler) met with lawyers Boies and Pottinger.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Date
events.description: A previously upcoming trial date on October 23, 2023, is mentioned. The declarant was eager to testify about Castellani, but the case settled beforehand.

events.title: Court's Final Hearing
events.description: The final hearing in the class action case is scheduled for November 9, 2023. The declarant expresses concern that survivors won't receive settlement offers until after this date.

locations: Undisclosed location outside of the United States of America
keyFacts: A JPMorgan Chase Bank executive, Adam Castellani, is alleged to have been assigned in January 2007 as a personal 'minder' to an Epstein victim to prevent her from reporting crimes to authorities.
The declarant claims JPMorgan was aware Epstein was a major client as early as 2004, evidenced by a media briefing email provided to Castellani.
Significant conflicts of interest are alleged against class counsel David Boies due to his relationships with Bill Clinton and past representation of Harvey Weinstein.
The declaration raises questions about the mysterious connections between lawyers David Boies, John Stanley Pottinger, Brad Edwards, and a man named 'Kessler' following Epstein's death.
The settlement administrator, Simone Lelank, is alleged to have conflicts due to her prior role in the Harvey Weinstein victim compensation process.
